result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy S Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to time now serving

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Pay costs of supervision, DNA surcharge and court obligations.  Comply with all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to time now serving

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: ORD that the motion is granted. Plaintiff-respondent's response brief shall be served and filed on or before July 2, 2019.
Atty. J. Pucek

ORD that the petition for review is granted and the defendant-appellant-petitioner may not raise or argue issues not set forth in the petition for review unless otherwise ordered by the court; and
FORD that within 30 days after the date of this order the defendant-appellant-petitioner must file a brief in this court; that within 20 days of filing the plaintiff-respondent, State of Wisconsin, must file either a brief or a statement that no brief will be filed; and that if a brief is filed by the plaintiff-respondent, within 10 days of filing the defendant-appellant-petitioner must file either a reply brief or a statement that no reply brief will be filed; and
FORD that in any brief filed in this court the parties shall not incorporate by reference any portion of their court of appeals' brief or petition for review or response; instead, any material in these documents upon which there is reliance should be
restated in the brief filed in this court; and
FORD that the first brief filed in this court must contain, as part of the appendix, a copy of the decision of the court of appeals in this case; and
FORD that, if a party has not previously filed an electronic copy of the briefs filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals, the party, within 30 days of the date of this order, must provide the clerk of this court with 10 copies of the brief previously filed on behalf of that party in the court of appeals, but if the party has already filed an electronic copy of such briefs, then there is no obligation to provide additional copies of those briefs to the clerk of this court; and
FORD that the allowance of costs, if any, in connection with the granting of the petition will abide the decision of tis court on review.

Preliminary hearing at 09-02-2015 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Roy S Anderson in court with attorney Keith David O'Donnell.  Defendant Roy S Anderson in custody.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
